item.title: Fortinet FortiWeb Fabric Connector Flaw Enables Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiWeb Fabric Connector; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25257; Summary: A severe pre-authentication SQL injection vulnerability in FortiWeb's Fabric Connector allows unauthenticated attackers to execute unauthorized SQL commands and potentially achieve remote code execution. The vulnerability affects multiple versions of FortiWeb, including 7.6.0 through 7.6.3, 7.4.0 through 7.4.7, 7.2.0 through 7.2.10, and 7.0.0 through 7.0.10, with patches available in newer versions.

item.title: DPC Investigates TikTok Over Transfer of EU User Data to China
item.description: The Data Protection Commission (DPC) has launched an inquiry into TikTok Technology Limited regarding the transfer and storage of European Economic Area (EEA) users' personal data to servers in China, citing discrepancies in previous submissions and concerns about accountability and transparency under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

item.title: COMmander: Network-Based Tool for COM and RPC Exploitation
item.description: This article introduces COMmander, a lightweight, C#-based utility designed to monitor Remote Procedure Call (RPC) and Component Object Model (COM) activities at a granular level. It captures low-level events from the Microsoft-Windows-RPC ETW provider, empowering defenders to uncover potential malicious behaviors.

item.title: Researchers Bypass Meta’s Llama Firewall Using Prompt Injection Vulnerabilities
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Meta's Llama Firewall; CVE(s): None; Summary: The Llama Firewall contains multiple vulnerabilities that allow attackers to bypass security measures and inject malicious prompts into language models. These vulnerabilities include multilingual and obfuscated injections, as well as Unicode-based invisible prompt injections. Exploitation details indicate that the firewall struggled to detect these types of attacks, allowing them to succeed in bypassing system safeguards.

item.title: GPUHammer: New RowHammer Attack Variant Degrades AI Models on NVIDIA GPUs
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA GPUs; CVE(s): None; Summary: A variant of RowHammer attacks, dubbed GPUHammer, has been demonstrated against NVIDIA's graphics processing units (GPUs), causing malicious users to tamper with other users' data by triggering bit flips in GPU memory. Enabling System-level Error Correction Codes (ECC) is advised as a defense against this type of attack.

item.title: Hackers are exploiting critical RCE flaw in Wing FTP Server
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Wing FTP Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47812, CVE-2025-27889, CVE-2025-47811, CVE-2025-47813; Summary: The Wing FTP Server has a critical remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2025-47812) that allows an unauthenticated attacker to execute code with the highest privileges on the system. Exploitation details include running multiple enumeration and reconnaissance commands followed by establishing persistence by creating new users, with the goal of achieving arbitrary code execution as root/SYSTEM.

item.title: Over 600 Laravel Apps Exposed to Remote Code Execution Due to Leaked APP_KEYs on GitHub
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Laravel; CVE(s): CVE-2018-15133, CVE-2024-55556; Summary: The vulnerability allows attackers to gain remote code execution capabilities by exploiting a deserialization flaw in Laravel's APP_KEY, which is often leaked publicly. This can be achieved by invoking the decrypt() function with a maliciously crafted payload.

item.title: ZDI-25-591: Delta Electronics DTM Soft BIN File Parsing Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Delta Electronics DTM Soft; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53415; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Delta Electronics DTM Soft. User interaction is required, and the specific flaw exists within the parsing of BIN files due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: New Windows 11 build adds self-healing “quick machine recovery” feature
item.description: This article discusses upcoming changes to Windows Insider preview build 27898, including new Taskbar features and updates to speech-to-text voice access. The release of Windows 11 25H2 is anticipated to be a minor update with no major under-the-hood changes, instead focusing on enabling previously installed features.

item.title: '123456' password exposed chats for 64 million McDonald’s job chatbot applications
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Paradox.ai McHire; CVE(s): None; Summary: The McHire job application platform, used by McDonald's franchisees, contains an Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerability that allows attackers to expose chat transcripts, session tokens, and personal data of real job applicants. The flaw was discovered by security researchers Ian Carroll and Sam Curry, who found that the ChatBot's admin panel utilized weak credentials and could be exploited to access sensitive information.

item.title: '123456' password exposed chats for 64 million McDonald’s job applicants
item.description: Vulnerable Product: McHire (McDonald's chatbot job application platform); CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability in McHire exposed the chats of over 64 million job applicants across the United States due to an IDOR (Insecure Direct Object Reference) flaw. By incrementing or decrementing a lead_id number, attackers could access sensitive data belonging to other applicants without verifying authorization.

item.title: '123456' password exposed info for 64 million McDonald’s job applicants
item.description: Vulnerable Product: McHire; CVE(s): None; Summary: The McHire chatbot job application platform has an IDOR (Insecure Direct Object Reference) vulnerability that exposes the personal information of over 64 million job applicants across the United States. The flaw allows attackers to access and retrieve sensitive data belonging to other applicants by incrementing or decrementing a lead_id number in a request.

item.title: Exploits for pre-auth Fortinet FortiWeb RCE flaw released, patch now
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiWeb; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25257; Summary: A critical SQL injection vulnerability (CWE-89) exists in FortiWeb's Fabric Connector, allowing unauthenticated attackers to execute unauthorized SQL code or commands via crafted HTTP requests. The flaw can be exploited to achieve pre-authenticated remote code execution on vulnerable servers.

item.title: WordPress Gravity Forms developer hacked to push backdoored plugins
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Gravity Forms (WordPress plugin); CVE(s): None; Summary: The Gravity Forms WordPress plugin was compromised in a supply-chain attack, allowing attackers to inject a backdoor and collect site metadata. The malware can be triggered by an unauthenticated user and enables remote code execution on the server.

item.title: ZDI-25-587: Luxion KeyShot 3DM File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Luxion KeyShot; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7222; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Luxion KeyShot by writing past the end of an allocated buffer. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The issue exists within the parsing of 3DM files and can be exploited to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-588: Trend Micro Cleaner One Pro Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro Cleaner One Pro; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53503; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Trend Micro Cleaner One Pro. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the Junk Files Cleanup functionality.

item.title: ZDI-25-589: Trend Micro Worry-Free Business Security Missing Authentication Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Trend Micro Worry-Free Business Security; CVE(s): ZDI-25-589, ZDI-CAN-25342, CVE-2025-53378; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to hijack security agents on affected installations of Trend Micro Worry-Free Business Security. It requires user interaction and exists within the agent activation API due to a lack of authentication prior to allowing access to functionality.

item.title: ZDI-25-590: G DATA Total Security GDTunerSvc Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: G DATA Total Security; CVE(s): CVE-2025-2790; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of G DATA Total Security. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, and can leverage it to delete arbitrary files and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: NVIDIA shares guidance to defend GDDR6 GPUs against Rowhammer attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA GDDR6 graphical processors; CVE(s): None; Summary: Rowhammer attacks can be triggered through software processes, causing memory cells to flip and potentially leading to denial-of-service conditions, data corruption, or privilege escalation. Enabling System Level Error-Correcting Codes (ECC) mitigates this risk.

item.title: NVIDIA shares guidance to defend GDDR6 GPUs against Rowhammer attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA; CVE(s): None; Summary: NVIDIA is warning users to enable System Level Error-Correcting Code (ECC) mitigation to protect against Rowhammer attacks on graphical processors with GDDR6 memory, as demonstrated by researchers at the University of Toronto. Enabling ECC can prevent data corruption, denial-of-service conditions, or privilege escalation.

item.title: The zero-day that could've compromised every Cursor and Windsurf user
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: OpenVSX; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability was discovered in OpenVSX, an open-source marketplace powering extensions for AI coding tools like VS Code and its forks. The flaw allowed an attacker to gain full control over the entire marketplace by stealing a powerful secret token that belongs to the trusted @open-vsx account. With this token, an attacker could publish updates, overwrite existing ones, and silently hijack the entire marketplace, leading to a supply chain nightmare.
Note: This is not a traditional vulnerability disclosure, as there are no CVEs assigned. However, based on the article's content, I've summarized the vulnerability according to your guidelines.

item.title: CISA tags Citrix Bleed 2 as exploited, gives agencies a day to patch
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Citrix NetScaler ADC and Gateway; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5777; Summary: A critical memory safety vulnerability (out-of-bounds memory read) allows unauthenticated attackers to access restricted parts of memory, impacting devices configured as a Gateway or AAA virtual server in versions prior to 14.1-43.56, 13.1-58.32, and others.

item.title: Fortinet Releases Patch for Critical SQL Injection Flaw in FortiWeb (CVE-2025-25257)
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiWeb; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25257; Summary: A critical SQL injection vulnerability (CVE-2025-25257) in FortiWeb allows an unauthenticated attacker to run arbitrary database commands, impacting versions 7.6.0-7.6.3, 7.4.0-7.4.7, 7.2.0-7.2.10, and 7.0.0-7.0.10; exploitation details involve using a Bearer token in an HTTP request to execute unauthorized SQL code or commands.

item.title: What Makes a Dark Web Monitoring Tool Effective?
item.description: This article provides an overview of Dark Web Monitoring tools, highlighting the importance of having a comprehensive solution that offers real-time alerts, broad darknet source coverage, credential leak detection, SIEM/SOAR integration, customizable monitoring rules, and visual threat dashboards. The article also emphasizes the need for AI-driven threat scoring, automated response support, and user-friendly interfaces to meet today's security demands.

item.title: CVE-2025-47812: Wing FTP Server Exposed to Root-Level RCE Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Wing FTP Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47812; Summary: A Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability exists in Wing FTP Server versions prior to 7.4.4, allowing attackers to inject arbitrary commands into session files managed by the server's Lua interpreter, leading to SYSTEM/root-level access without authentication.

item.title: PerfektBlue Bluetooth Vulnerabilities Expose Millions of Vehicles to Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: OpenSynergy BlueSDK; CVE(s): CVE-2024-45434, CVE-2024-45431, CVE-2024-45433, CVE-2024-45432; Summary: The vulnerabilities in OpenSynergy's BlueSDK Bluetooth stack can be exploited to achieve remote code execution on millions of transport vehicles from different vendors, potentially allowing attackers to track GPS coordinates, record audio, access contact lists, and take control of critical software functions.

item.title: What Are the Main Benefits of Dark Web Monitoring?
item.description: This article highlights the importance of monitoring the Dark Web to detect early signs of danger, prevent data breaches, and protect brand reputation. It emphasizes the benefits of Dark Web monitoring, including detecting leaked credentials, compromised customer records, and internal documents, as well as providing real-time alerts to take action against threats.

item.title: Securing Data in the AI Era
item.description: The 2025 Data Risk Report highlights the risks of data loss through AI-fueled tools, SaaS applications, email, file-sharing services, and other digital channels. The report reveals trends such as millions of data loss incidents through AI apps like ChatGPT and Microsoft Copilot, surging SaaS data loss, and significant email and file-sharing data loss.

item.title: Critical Wing FTP Server Vulnerability (CVE-2025-47812) Actively Being Exploited in the Wild
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Wing FTP Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47812; Summary: The Wing FTP Server has a maximum-severity security flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-47812, that allows remote code execution through improper handling of null ('\0') bytes in the server's web interface. This can be exploited via anonymous FTP accounts, enabling threat actors to download and execute malicious Lua files, conduct reconnaissance, and install remote monitoring and management software.

item.title: Iranian-Backed Pay2Key Ransomware Resurfaces with 80% Profit Share for Cybercriminals
item.description: An Iranian-backed ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) named Pay2Key has resurfaced, offering bigger payouts to cybercriminals who launch attacks against Israel and the U.S. The RaaS platform, hosted on the Invisible Internet Project (I2P), is linked to a hacking group tracked as Fox Kitten (aka Lemon Sandstorm) and appears to partner with or incorporate Mimic ransomware's capabilities.

item.title: Evolving Tactics of SLOW#TEMPEST: A Deep Dive Into Advanced Malware Techniques
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: SLOW#TEMPEST malware; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article analyzes a malware variant related to the SLOW#TEMPEST campaign, which employs obfuscation techniques such as control flow graph (CFG) obfuscation using dynamic jumps and obfuscated function calls. The malware's authors use these techniques to hinder static analysis and make detection more challenging.
FYSA: The article highlights the importance of adopting advanced dynamic analysis techniques alongside static analysis to effectively dissect and understand modern malware.

item.title: CISA Adds Citrix NetScaler CVE-2025-5777 to KEV Catalog as Active Exploits Target Enterprises
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Citrix; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5777; Summary: An instance of insufficient input validation in Citrix NetScaler ADC and Gateway allows an attacker to bypass authentication when the appliance is configured as a Gateway or AAA virtual server, leading to memory overread. This vulnerability (CVE-2025-5777) has been weaponized in the wild and can be exploited by sending the same payload repeatedly, causing sensitive information to be leaked.

item.title: Pro basketball player and 4 youths arrested in connection to ransomware crimes
item.description: Authorities in the UK arrested four individuals, including three men and one woman, in connection with separate and unrelated ransomware operations. The attacks targeted M&S, Co-op, and Harrods, and were attributed to Scattered Spider, a group that uses impersonation and phishing tactics to gain access to networks.

item.title: Windows 11 now uses JScript9Legacy engine for improved security
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft JScript; CVE(s): None; Summary: Microsoft replaced the default scripting engine JScript with JScript9Legacy on Windows 11 version 24H2 and later to improve security against web threats such as cross-site scripting (XSS). The outdated JScript engine was a frequent target of memory corruption, arbitrary code execution, and XSS vulnerabilities.

item.title: Patch, track, repeat
item.description: The article discusses various cybersecurity-related topics, including the end of free support for Windows 10, concerns about the long-term stability of the CVE system, and an increase in Known Exploited Vulnerabilities. It also mentions several notable threats and attacks, such as a Chinese hacker tied to the Silk Typhoon group being arrested, malicious Chrome extensions with 1.7 million downloads, and a ransomware attack on Ingram Micro.

item.title: UK Charges Four in ‘Scattered Spider’ Ransom Group
item.description: Scattered Spider, a data theft and extortion group, has been targeted by law enforcement in the UK, with four alleged members arrested. The group is known for using social engineering tactics to gain access to companies' systems and steal data for ransom.

item.title: Critical mcp-remote Vulnerability Enables Remote Code Execution, Impacting 437,000+ Downloads
item.description: Vulnerable Product: JFrog mcp-remote; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6514; Summary: The mcp-remote project contains a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-6514) that allows attackers to execute arbitrary operating system commands, posing a significant risk to users.

item.title: Russian pro basketball player arrested for alleged role in ransomware attacks
item.description: Russian professional basketball player Daniil Kasatkin was arrested in France at the request of the United States for allegedly acting as a negotiator for a ransomware gang. The arrest is part of an international effort to disrupt and prosecute cybercrime.

item.title: PerfektBlue Bluetooth flaws impact Mercedes, Volkswagen, Skoda cars
item.description: Vulnerable Product: OpenSynergy BlueSDK; CVE(s): CVE-2024-45434, CVE-2024-45431, CVE-2024-45433, CVE-2024-45432; Summary: Four vulnerabilities in the OpenSynergy BlueSDK Bluetooth stack allow remote code execution and potentially grant access to critical elements in vehicles from multiple vendors.

item.title: Asus and Adobe vulnerabilities
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Asus Armoury Crate; CVE(s): TALOS-2025-2144 (CVE-2025-1533), TALOS-2025-2150 (CVE-2022-3464); Summary: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the AsIO3.sys kernel driver of Asus Armoury Crate 5.9.13.0 allows an unprivileged attacker to run a program from user mode, while an authorization bypass vulnerability in the AsIO3.sys functionality can be triggered by creating a specially crafted hard link.
Vulnerable Product: Adobe Acrobat Reader; CVE(s): TALOS-2025-2159 (CVE-2025-43578), TALOS-2025-2170 (CVE-2025-43576); Summary: An out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the Font functionality of Adobe Acrobat Reader 2025.001.20435 allows disclosure of sensitive information, while a use-after-free vulnerability in the annotation object processing functionality can lead to memory corruption and arbitrary code execution.

item.title: Fake Gaming and AI Firms Push Malware on Cryptocurrency Users via Telegram and Discord
item.description: Cryptocurrency users are being targeted by a social engineering campaign that uses fake startup companies to trick them into downloading malware. The campaign employs spoofed social media accounts and project documentation on legitimate platforms like Notion and GitHub, and has been ongoing since at least March 2024.

item.title: FBI's CJIS demystified: Best practices for passwords, MFA & access control
item.description: The article discusses the Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS) Security Policy, which governs how criminal histories, fingerprints, and investigation files must be protected. It explains the origins of CJIS, its purpose, and why it matters to organizations handling criminal-justice information. The article also covers the pillars of identity (passwords, multifactor authentication, and strict access controls), and provides guidance on how to embed these controls seamlessly into an environment.

item.title: Four arrested in UK over M&S, Co-op, Harrods cyberattacks
item.description: Four individuals, including two 19-year-old males, one 17-year-old male, and a 20-year-old female, were arrested by the UK's National Crime Agency (NCA) for suspected involvement in cyberattacks on major retailers, including Marks & Spencer, Co-op, and Harrods. The suspects are believed to be linked to Scattered Spider, a threat actor group known for numerous breaches over the past few years.

item.title: Four arrested in UK over M&S, Co-op, Harrod cyberattacks
item.description: The UK's National Crime Agency (NCA) arrested four individuals suspected of involvement in cyberattacks on major retailers, including Marks & Spencer, Co-op, and Harrods. The attacks were attributed to threat actors classified as Scattered Spider, with a history of breaches over the past few years.

item.title: Dark Web Profile: Arkana Ransomware
item.description: Arkana Ransomware is a group that emerged in early 2025, claiming to have stolen customer databases and taken control of key backend systems. They are part of the Qilin Network, a Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) platform.

item.title: What Is a Dark Web Monitoring API?
item.description: This article discusses the importance of Dark Web Monitoring APIs in detecting cyber threats and preventing attacks. It highlights the benefits of using such tools, including real-time alerts, broad coverage, and seamless integration into existing security systems. The article also provides best practices for setting up and configuring dark web monitoring APIs, as well as legal considerations and regulatory requirements.

item.title: Four Arrested in £440M Cyber Attack on Marks & Spencer, Co-op, and Harrods
item.description: The article reports on the arrest of four individuals suspected of being involved in cyber attacks targeting major retailers in the UK. The attacks are believed to be perpetrated by a decentralized cybercrime group called Scattered Spider, which is notorious for its advanced social engineering tactics and willingness to be persistent in gaining initial access to targets.

item.title: End-of-Train and Head-of-Train Remote Linking Protocol
item.description: Vulnerable Product: End-of-Train and Head-of-Train remote linking protocol; CVE(s): CVE-2025-1727; Summary: The vulnerability allows an attacker to send their own brake control commands to the end-of-train device, potentially causing a sudden stoppage or inducing brake failure. Exploitation requires low attack complexity and can be achieved through software-defined radio and a malicious packet.

item.title: Siemens Solid Edge
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Siemens Solid Edge SE2025; CVE(s): CVE-2025-40739, CVE-2025-40740, CVE-2025-40741; Summary: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to crash the application or execute arbitrary code. The affected applications contain out-of-bounds read past the end of an allocated structure while parsing specially crafted PAR files, which could allow an attacker to execute code in the context of the current process.
